pattern.name: Change ratio
pattern.description:
Ratio of increases to decreases in time.
Note: The value is regularized toward 1. When no change happens, 1 is returned. Also by using regularization we avoid division by zero.
pattern.example: Detect, whether the person is a seller (many small incomes, a few big expenses) or an employee (many small expenses, a few incomes).
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , (sum(change_up)+1) / (sum(change_down)+1) AS "@columnName" FROM ( SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , (CASE WHEN lag(@column) OVER (ORDER BY @timeColumn) < @column THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) change_up , (CASE WHEN lag(@column) OVER (ORDER BY @timeColumn) > @column THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) change_down FROM @propagatedTable ) t GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget
